meanings.def: abbreviation for Common Era, the year numbering system used in the Gregorian calendar
meanings.example: The inscription is dated 125 CE.

meanings.def: abbreviation for Common Era, the secular alternative to AD in calendar dates
meanings.example: Scholars now write 30 C.E. instead of AD 30.

meanings.def: the calendar era that counts years from the traditional birth of Jesus, used in the Gregorian calendar
meanings.example: The temple was rebuilt in the first century Common Era.

meanings.def: on the basis of guesswork or incomplete evidence
meanings.example: The fossil was conjecturally assigned to the new genus.

meanings.def: in sequence without interruption
meanings.example: She won three championships consecutively.

meanings.def: continually over a period of time
meanings.example: The shoreline is constantly reshaped by the tide.

meanings.def: regularly and without fail
meanings.example: He constantly checks in on his grandparents.

meanings.def: almost or approximately
meanings.example: The town is close to fifty miles from here.

meanings.def: with the same boundaries or extent
meanings.example: The school districts were redrawn coterminously with the new wards.

meanings.def: entirely, with nothing lacking
meanings.example: The room was completely silent after the announcement.

meanings.def: to remove dirt or unwanted material from something
meanings.example: She cleaned the counters after cooking dinner.

meanings.def: to make a place neat and orderly
meanings.example: They cleaned the apartment before the guests arrived.

meanings.def: free from dirt, pollution, or contamination
meanings.example: The lab requires clean instruments for every experiment.

meanings.def: not using illegal drugs or banned substances
meanings.example: He has been clean for five years after entering treatment.

meanings.def: fair and honest, without cheating or foul play
meanings.example: Officials praised the team for playing a clean game.

meanings.def: completely or thoroughly
meanings.example: The wind knocked the sign clean off its post.

meanings.def: a weightlifting movement that raises the barbell to the shoulders
meanings.example: She set a personal record with a smooth clean before the jerk.

meanings.def: in a way that provides physical ease or relaxation
meanings.example: The child slept comfortably through the night.

meanings.def: with enough resources to avoid financial strain
meanings.example: They can live comfortably on a single income.

meanings.def: to a large degree
meanings.example: The new engine is considerably more efficient.

meanings.def: with vigor and spirited energy, especially in music
meanings.example: The orchestra attacked the finale con brio.

meanings.def: in thorough detail
meanings.example: The witness described the evening circumstantially.

meanings.def: on the basis of surrounding circumstances rather than direct proof
meanings.example: They were convicted circumstantially by the available evidence.

meanings.def: in a manner consistent with something else
meanings.example: The policy was applied conformably with the new regulations.

meanings.def: according to accepted customs or standards
meanings.example: The house is conventionally heated with gas.

meanings.def: a planned series of lessons or lectures on a subject
meanings.example: She enrolled in a summer course on statistics.

meanings.def: a single part of a meal served at one time
meanings.example: Dinner ended with a light dessert course.

meanings.def: the route or direction along which something moves
meanings.example: The river changes course near the delta.

meanings.def: a way of acting or proceeding
meanings.example: The board chose a cautious course after the setback.

meanings.def: to flow or move swiftly
meanings.example: Tears coursed down his face.

meanings.def: in a way that is easy to perceive or understand
meanings.example: The instructions are clearly written on the label.

meanings.def: without doubt
meanings.example: She is clearly the best candidate for the role.

meanings.def: in an unusual or unexpected manner
meanings.example: The solution tasted curiously sweet.

meanings.def: with inquisitive interest
meanings.example: The students curiously examined the fossils.

meanings.def: at the present time
meanings.example: She is currently working from home.

meanings.def: as a result of what has just been mentioned
meanings.example: The road was closed; consequently, traffic was diverted through town.

meanings.def: in relation to color or hue
meanings.example: The stones were arranged chromatically from red to violet.

meanings.def: in order of time of occurrence
meanings.example: The archive is organized chronologically by decade.

meanings.def: based on direct medical observation or treatment
meanings.example: The illness is clinically distinct from the common cold.

meanings.def: in an objective, unemotional manner
meanings.example: She described the accident clinically despite the shock.

meanings.def: by means of a catalyst or catalytic action
meanings.example: The reaction proceeded catalytically under mild heat.

meanings.def: from a business or market perspective
meanings.example: The film succeeded commercially despite poor reviews.

meanings.def: with the order reversed or on the other hand
meanings.example: She loves hiking; conversely, her brother prefers the city.

meanings.def: for the sake of improving appearance
meanings.example: The scar was treated cosmetically with laser therapy.

meanings.def: in a secret or concealed manner
meanings.example: The agents met covertly to exchange information.

meanings.def: for the most part
meanings.example: The festival is attended chiefly by local families.

meanings.def: in a way that deserves contempt
meanings.example: He acted contemptibly by lying to his closest friends.

meanings.def: with open scorn or disdain
meanings.example: She contemptuously dismissed the rumor.

meanings.def: repeatedly over an extended period
meanings.example: The phone rang continually throughout the evening.

meanings.def: in a grossly insulting manner
meanings.example: He spoke contumeliously to the officials and was removed.

meanings.def: as required by a contract
meanings.example: The company is contractually obligated to provide maintenance.

meanings.def: in a wild or irrational manner
meanings.example: Fans cheered crazily when the team scored.

meanings.def: in an amusing or ridiculous way
meanings.example: The umbrella folded comically in the gust of wind.

meanings.def: quickly and without delay
meanings.example: Finish your homework, chop-chop!

meanings.def: in a way that settles a question or dispute
meanings.example: The DNA evidence conclusively identified the suspect.

meanings.def: with respect to the cerebral cortex
meanings.example: The neurons are cortically distributed across the frontal lobe.

meanings.def: without exceptions or qualifications
meanings.example: She categorically denied the allegations.

meanings.def: in or near the center, or playing a central role
meanings.example: The offices are centrally located near the station.

meanings.def: as a group or in cooperation
meanings.example: The neighbors collectively agreed to start the garden.

meanings.def: together with another or others
meanings.example: The two firms worked conjointly on the proposal.

meanings.def: usually or ordinarily
meanings.example: This plant is commonly found in wet meadows.

meanings.def: persisting for a long time or recurring frequently
meanings.example: She has been chronically sleep-deprived for months.

meanings.def: in a way that conflicts with other statements or facts
meanings.example: He testified contradictorily about the timeline.

meanings.def: at the same time
meanings.example: Two workshops will run concurrently on Saturday.

meanings.def: in a uniform and reliable manner
meanings.example: The goalkeeper consistently makes crucial saves.

meanings.def: with respect to culture or shared practices
meanings.example: The program is culturally tailored to the community.

meanings.def: in terms of chemical composition or reactions
meanings.example: The two compounds are chemically similar.

meanings.def: by using chemical substances
meanings.example: The weeds were chemically treated in early spring.

meanings.def: by a choir or group of singers
meanings.example: The anthem was chorally accompanied by the students.

meanings.def: in a manner permitted or defined by a constitution
meanings.example: The bill was constitutionally challenged in court.

meanings.def: by means of chromatography
meanings.example: Pigments were separated chromatographically for analysis.

meanings.def: through comparison of multiple languages
meanings.example: The feature appears cross-linguistically in unrelated families.

meanings.def: without doubt; surely
meanings.example: I will certainly call you tomorrow.

meanings.def: with disastrous consequences
meanings.example: The dam failed catastrophically after the storm.

meanings.def: within the brain
meanings.example: The hemorrhage occurred cerebrally rather than in the spinal cord.

meanings.def: in an intellectual or analytical way
meanings.example: The novel is cerebrally challenging but rewarding.

meanings.def: without sufficient attention or concern
meanings.example: He carelessly left the door unlocked overnight.

meanings.def: with close attention to detail
meanings.example: She carefully measured each ingredient.

meanings.def: cautiously, so as to avoid harm or error
meanings.example: He carefully carried the fragile vase across the room.
